definition: to adopt confrontational posture/to meet head-on/to compete
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress
dry/clean/in vain/dried food/foster/adoptive/to ignore
variant of 乾|干[gan1]
old variant of 乾|干[gan1]
to concern/to interfere/shield/stem
surname Gan
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: But it's a difficult thing, being a parent who objects to what a school is doing.
sentences.chinese: 虽然作为一个家长和学校对着干很困难。

sentences.english: Then who was it that countermanded my orders?
sentences.chinese: 是谁跟我的命令对着干？

sentences.english: Even your wardrobe turns against you.
sentences.chinese: 连你的衣柜也跟你对着干。

sentences.english: But you can't put your finger on what the source of that confrontation was.
sentences.chinese: 但是你还是搞不明白为什么她老是要跟你对着干。

definition: to express a different view/to take a different position
to set oneself against/to oppose/to make a pair
to put on a rival show (idiom); to set oneself up against sb/to get into confrontation
to talk back/to answer back
erhua variant of 較勁|较劲[jiao4 jin4]
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
to quarrel (dialect)
to contradict (elders or superiors)
to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
to match one's strength with/to compete/more competitive/to set oneself against sb/disobliging/to make a special effort
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
to get into a dispute with
to make life difficult for/to embarrass/unable to make it through
to signal the musicians (in Chinese opera, by prolonging a spoken word before attacking a song)/(coll.) to challenge
